name: DHT22
description: A digital temperature and humidity sensor. It uses a capacitive humidity sensor and a thermistor to measure the surrounding air, and spits out a digital signal on the data pin (no analog input pins needed)

name: HPP828E031 (SHT21)
description: Digital Temperature and Relative Humidity Sensor

measurement.name: humidity
measurement.description: Relative humidity is a measure of the amount of moisture in the air relative to the total amount of moisture the air can hold. For instance, if the relative humidity was 50%, then the air is only half saturated with moisture.

measurement.name: air temperature
measurement.description: Air temperature is a measure of how hot or cold the air is. It is the most commonly measured weather parameter. Air temperature is dependent on the amount and strength of the sunlight hitting the earth, and atmospheric conditions, such as cloud cover and humidity, which trap heat.

measurement.name: nets
measurement.description: The amount of Wi-Fi networks visible by the SCK.

measurement.name: light
measurement.description: Lux is a measure of how much light is spread over a given area. A full moon clear night is around 1 lux, inside an office building you usually have 400 lux and a bright day can be more than 20000 lux.

measurement.name: mA
measurement.description: Current

name: NO2-B42F+ISB
description: Alphasense Nitrogen Dioxide with Individual Sensor Board

measurement.name: no2
measurement.description: Nitrogen dioxide is a toxic gas. It is a pollutant in some urban areas due the excess air required for complete combustion of fuels introduces nitrogen into the combustion of internal combustion engines (cars, trucks, ships...) and power stations. ⚠ Note: values are offered in RS (sensor resistance in kOhm) as a relative measurement from the R0 (sensor zero resistance). Due to sensor intra-model variability we recommend using this as a relative measurement within the same kit readings.

measurement.name: air temperature
measurement.description: Air temperature is a measure of how hot or cold the air is. It is the most commonly measured weather parameter. Air temperature is dependent on the amount and strength of the sunlight hitting the earth, and atmospheric conditions, such as cloud cover and humidity, which trap heat.

name: POM-3044P-R
description: Electret microphone with envelope follower sound pressure sensor (noise)

measurement.name: noise
measurement.description: dB's measure sound pressure difference between the average local pressure and the pressure in the sound wave.  A quiet library is below 40dB, your house is around 50dB and a diesel truck in your street 90dB.

measurement.name: ionising radiation
measurement.description: Ionising radiation (ionizing radiation) is radiation that carries enough energy to free electrons from atoms or molecules, thereby ionizing them. Gamma rays, X-rays, and the higher ultraviolet part of the electromagnetic spectrum are ionizing.

measurement.name: co
measurement.description: Carbon monoxide is a colorless, odorless, and tasteless gas. measurement.name: humidity

measurement.name: barometric pressure
measurement.description: Barometric pressure is the pressure within the atmosphere of Earth. In most circumstances atmospheric pressure is closely approximated by the hydrostatic pressure caused by the weight of air above the measurement point.

measurement.description: Nitrogen dioxide is a toxic gas. measurement.name: o3
measurement.description: Ozone is found naturally in small concentrations in the stratosphere, a layer of Earth's upper atmosphere. However it can also be found in the lowest layer of the atmosphere. Tropospheric ozone (often termed "bad" ozone) is man-made, a result of air pollution from internal combustion engines and power plants.

measurement.name: co aux electrode
measurement.description: In Alphasense Series B Electrochemical Sensors, the auxiliary electrode is an electrode of the same characteristics to those of the working electrode, but it is buried inside an electrolite and, hence, it is not in contact with the target gas. Since it is isolated from external conditions that could affect the working electrode, it serves as a reference to the measurements provided by the latter.

measurement.name: o3 aux electrode
measurement.description: In Alphasense Series B Electrochemical Sensors, the auxiliary electrode is an electrode of the same characteristics to those of the working electrode, but it is buried inside an electrolite and, hence, it is not in contact with the target gas. Since it is isolated from external conditions that could affect the working electrode, it serves as a reference to the measurements provided by the latter.
